questions.question: You are launching a cab booking app in Burundi as a Product Head of an NGO - Africa Go. Do you know? Burundi is a small country in Africa and it's the poorest country in the world. The app will be launched in Gitega which is the capital of Burundi and this will be the first mobility app to be launched in Burundi. The peak load on the app is estimated to be 120 requests per second for 4 hours during working days, an average load of 20 requests per second and expansion to other cities isn't feasible soon. Which system architecture will you recommend?
questions.explanation: 4 hours during working days, an average load of 20 requests per second and expansion to other

questions.question: You are a Product Manager at Google and building a social media app like Twitter. The engineering team recommends using NoSQL database for storing data posted by users on the news feed and its related metadata like comments, likes, replies etc. Which of the following statements is not true about NoSQL databases?

answerOptions.answer: NoSQL databases are schema-less, allowing for flexible and dynamic data models.
NoSQL databases are generally more suitable for handling complex queries and transactions compared to traditional relational databases.
NoSQL databases are designed to horizontally scale by adding more servers to the database cluster.
NoSQL databases provide strong ACID (Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability) properties for data consistency and integrity.

questions.explanation: databases are generally more suitable for handling complex queries and transactions compared to traditional relational databases.

questions.question: Have you heard about REST API? REST is nothing but a set of rules/architecture pattern that is used to design API. As a Fintech Product Manager, you will be designing a lot of APIs. You want to edit a piece of information on the server using REST API. Which restful method will you use?

Have you heard about the Pareto Principle? It states that roughly 80% of consequences come from 20% of causes. Similarly, if Money Heist is trending, it is anticipated that many users will want to watch it at the same time. To serve users faster, the content is fetched from a temporary memory location instead of the database. This technique is called:

You went to a hotel. The receptionist gives you a card to access your room number 560. You use the card and open the door. A day later, you are stuck in a meeting and give that card to your friend to collect your luggage. This process of handling access is called:

You are a Product Manager at a credit card company with a 40mn+ card disbursal in the last 10 years. The recent card disbursal is marked with high defaults and low recovery. You want to predict the default rate of each user before disbursing a card. Which machine learning algorithm will you use?

You have 20 TB of memory for managing a flight booking app. As the growth explodes, you need an additional 30 TB of memory. You decide to address this by adding one more cluster of 40 TB, in addition to the existing 20 TB. This process of adding more memory is called:
Webhooks are a very common term in the Internet industry these days. Which of the following is incorrect about Webhooks?

answerOptions.answer: Many other modern web services like GitHub and Slack also make use of webhooks to communicate events.
Webhook is a server sending payload to the client on a specified location when an event happens
Webhook is a real-time notification system
Webhooks are a toolkit used by developers instead of APIs for faster development

questions.question: To perform thorough testing of new features, bug fixes, or updates. An environment is set up that closely resembles the production environment. This environment is called:
___________ refers to the amount of data transmitted successfully over a network or processed by a system in a specific time period, such as 100 megabytes per second.

answerOptions.answer: NoSQL databases are schema-less, allowing for flexible and dynamic data models.
NoSQL databases are generally more suitable for handling complex queries and transactions compared to traditional relational databases.
NoSQL databases are designed to horizontally scale by adding more servers to the database cluster.
NoSQL databases provide strong ACID (Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability) properties for data consistency and integrity.
